name: Red Lake
description: Red Lake - horror shooter with elements of quest.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E4500 @ 2.2GHz | AMD Athlon 64 X2 5600+ @ 2.8 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 240 GT | Radeon HD 6570 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Don't buy this garbage. It's so bad that it doesn't deserve full review.

I don't care about terrible Unity 3D asset store assets, and generic FPS controls, but the game is unplayable. I picked up a key in a building early in the game and died, and had to restart. I did nothing to deserve to die ! Bad translation aside it should not be this unplayable. I don't know how to progress. There is some effort put into this idea, but these guys don't know how to make a game with even basic standard options. Should be taken off steam!
The lake is red because of the blood pouring from my eyes.
It opened my eyes to a new world. A world in which three legged dogs chase after you trying to pick you up.  Good game. I give it a Red Lake/Red Lake rating.
I believe they took more time developing this sales page than they did this game. I'm mostly surprised at this game not having cards, yet having people with more than half an hour game play time.
Most lousy game lately played. Getting attacked by anything in melee keeps you levitating. No feeling of danger, and animations made by drunken one handed ♥♥♥♥♥♥.
Where too start...I have to say the visials are pretty good like the grass and the trees but everything els is horrible..
Best horror game ever 101/10 ign Would spook again

This game absolutely blew me away.   First off, how i got this game was almost by fate. I bought a random Steam CD key from a G(2)A for fun and decided it was worth the investment. Boy, was I willy wonky right!!!   Red Lake provides nothing short of fantastic visuals, with it's realistic graphics, stunning 3D animations and A.I., bone-chilling and atmospheric music, in-depth and all out customizable controls, top of the line and detailed guns with only the most bountiful arsenal, and best of yet: breath taking gameplay.   This game had me on edge for every single minute that I invested in it and I will never regret having spent all those sweet and precious moments playing this game. In fact, this game was so ♥♥♥♥ing amazing that I didnt even want to beat it. Kinda like tearing out the last page of a book so it never ends :D  I would reccomend this life changing game to anyone and everyone. Kids, adults, seniors, whoever the person and whatever the age, this game fits all. To all of those that hate the game, they're just jealous of it's majesty and magnificence. Only nobodys would judge such a perfect and spotless game, they're all inferior.  This game took my heart and soul and gave back so much more.  12/10
